intro: Fumaria officinalis subsp. media, commonly known as the common celandine, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. It is often found in Europe and parts of Asia, where it has adapted to a variety of environmental conditions. The subspecies media is notable for its medicinal uses, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
